projects.name: Technologies, innovative practices and knowledge promoted to sustainably increase rural agriculture productivity
projects.description: Outcome 1 of the sustainable rural agricultural development project (SRAD) focusing on identification, piloting, and demonstration of innovative production technologies and good practices, and promoting their wider adoption by smallholders, to sustainably increase the productivity of crops (coffee, subtropical fruits, rainfed cereals, and rose), livestock, beekeeping, and fisheries and aquaculture.
projects.outcome: Rural  agriculture sector sustainably developed for enhanced production, value addition and employment opportunities.

projects.name: 4.2: Strengthened capacity of government institutions at all levels to increase accountability, transparency and reliability

projects.name: Strengthening capacities of Saudi cities to adopt the global Quality of Life Index
projects.description: The Quality of Life Initiative is a global effort to define, measure, and enhance urban quality of life through a data-driven, approach. Anchored in nine core domains—health, housing, economy, environment, governance, basic services & mobility, culture & recreation, social cohesion, and education—the initiative integrates both global indicators and locally co-created metrics to capture diverse urban realities. projects.name: National Urban Policy for the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia
projects.description:
The National Urban Policy (NUP) initiative provides a national framework to guide how cities and settlements grow and function. It brings together spatial planning, economic development, housing, infrastructure, and social inclusion into one coherent direction. The aim is to support balanced development across regions, improve quality of life, and align urban growth with national priorities and long-term sustainability goals.

projects.name: Strengthened national social protection system and public finance for children through influencing the social protection reform process and promoting family-friendly policies
projects.description: The primary objectives of UNICEF's social policy programme is to reduce child poverty and vulnerability by influencing public policies and social practices to promote equitable and inclusive social protection systems that benefit all children, especially the most disadvantaged. This involves strengthening social protection systems, increasing and improving the use of public resources for child-focused services, generating data on child poverty, and advocating for child-sensitive policies at nat
projects.outcome: Enhanced access to essential inclusive social and protection services for all, based on principles of human rights, gender equality, and inclusion of the most vulnerable populations.

projects.name: Foster cooperative development in KSA through policy development, and techncial and capacity building support
projects.description: The ILO is supporting Saudi Arabia’s cooperative sector by enhancing its policy, regulatory framework, governance, and capacity-building efforts. This includes reviewing the National Cooperative Strategy and the Executive Regulation of the Cooperative Law to align them with international labor standards and best practices. The ILO is also working to strengthen the Cooperative Societies Council (CSC), refining its role as an Apex organization to better support cooperatives across the Kingdom. To
projects.outcome: Strenghtened policy and legal frameworks in the labor sector to protect workers' rights and support equitable employment opportunities and safer labour migration

projects.name: Drought Resilience and Sand and Dust Storm Mitigation
projects.description: ESCWA helped Saudi Arabia to launch two landmark initiatives at UNCCD COP16 in 2024: the Riyadh Global Drought Resilience Partnership, targeting 80 countries most vulnerable to drought, and the Sand and Dust Storm Monitoring Initiative, which aims to expand global early warning system capacity. The latter will be operated by the GCC Regional Sand and Dust Storms Warning Advisory and Assessment Node at the National Center for Meteorology in Jeddah. projects.name: Buraidah Voluntary Local Review
projects.description: ESCWA is working with UN-Habitat and government counterpart in Saudi Arabia to finalize its first Voluntary Local Review (VLR), the Buraidah VLR. This marks a significant milestone in aligning the SDGs framework with local efforts to address urban challenges effectively. The VLR has garnered strong support from all levels of government. projects.description: Significant and limiting gaps exist in terms of availability, quality currency and indept analysis of data and programme information on the situation of children across all five countries. projects.name: Strengthening Water and Sanitation Monitoring in KSA
projects.description: A workshop “Monitoring and Reporting of SDG 6 in Saudi Arabia” was co-organized by UNDP and Ministry of Environment, Water and Agriculture with the support of UN-Water. The event brought together SDG 6 indicator custodian agencies to strengthen collaboration and support the Kingdom’s efforts in advancing and reporting on clean water and sanitation initiatives.

In the Arab Region, UNESCO supports teacher policies, professional development, and inclusive education systems, working closely with Member States to address teacher shortages and improve quality education. projects.description:
The Kingdom of Saudi Arabia has joined the Greening Education Partnership and has participated to the Ministerial roundtable at COP28 organized by UNESCO. Building on this engagement, UNESCO is working at the national level to ensure that greening education related activities are introduced in the curricular and extra-curricular activities.
